message.content:
cs.IT, cs.NI, cs.SY, cs.MA, cs.LG. 

The paper deals with wireless networks and scheduling problems, which are typically studied in the Information Theory (cs.IT) and Networking and Internet Architecture (cs.NI) sub-categories. The use of Whittle's index and restless multi-armed bandit formulation suggests a focus on optimization and decision-making, which are also relevant to the Systems and Control (cs.SY) and Machine Learning (cs.MA) sub-categories. Finally, the proposed random access scheme and analysis of deadline guarantees may fall under the Learning (cs.LG) sub-category, which includes topics related to online decision-making and optimization.
